result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler N. Hoople was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler N. Hoople

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: requesting to serve jail in Lincoln county - granted

1:24 p.m. Defendant Tyler N. Hoople in court, in custody, with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher. Mary Sowinski, Asst, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CF93, 15CF139, 15CF181, 15CM154. Court statement. Counsel in receipt of revocation summary. Sowinski notices typographical errors on p. 7-8 of DOC summary--references Lincoln County when these are clearly Oneida County cases. Sowinski defers to DOC recommendation. Sowinski/Streicher statement to sentencing. Court statement--orders all fines/costs/restitution to civil judgment. 

15CF93 - Ct. 2 - consecutive to 15CF181 Ct. 2, concurrent to all others
6 mos. county jail w/Huber

15CF139 - Ct.1 - consecutive to 15CF181 Ct. 2, concurrent to all others
6 mos. county jail w/Huber

15CF181 Ct. 2 
Ct. 2 - 9 mos. county jail w/Huber
126 days' credit
Ct. 1 - 90 days' county jail, consecutive to Ct. 2, concurrent to all others

15CM154 - Ct. 2 consecutive to 15CF181 Ct. 2, concurren to all others
8 mos. county jail
60 days' credit
Appeal rights given for all cases
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 1, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
- includes revocation summary and cover letter
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 17, 2016 at 11:15 am.

10:35 am - Defendant Tyler N. Hoople in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf93, 15cf139, 15cf181 and 15cm154.  In 15cf93 - State moves to dismiss but read in Count 1 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 2.  In 15cf139 - State moves to dismiss but read in Counts 2 and 3 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  In 15cf181 - State moves to dismiss but read in Counts 3 and 4 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 1 and 2.  In 15cm154 - State moves to dismiss but read in Counts 1 and 3 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 2.  Plea questionnaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Debord/Randy Webie (Defendant's Father)/Court statement to sentencing.  
Court Sentence 15cm154, 15cf181 Count 1, 15cf139 and 15cf93 - CC
WHS/POP 2 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge (1 count)/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
Attend school during the school year and continue in program until graduated and obtained diploma or equivalency
Obtain/maintain full time employment/student status
Community Service 100 hrs
Restitution $2,097.70 (Includes 10% Surcharge) J&S
Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes probation and completed all conditions of probation and pays all costs/restitution
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Court Sentence 15cf181 - Count 2
Impose and Stay 9 months Jail - W/Huber for all purposes
Probation 2 yrs
Same conditions Count 1
Appeal rights given -   The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Adjourned 11:03 a.m.

01:36 pm - Defendant Tyler N. Hoople in court, via video, with attorney Michael K. DeBord.  Defendant Tyler N. Hoople in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Debord will appear on this case for today's purposes - PD's office needs to be contacted regarding the new case.  Calling 15cf139 (Initial) In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing.  Michlig/Debord/Defendant's employer/Webie, Defendant's father, to bond.  Court sets surety bond - Father, Randy Webie, to sign as surety.  Prelim time limits waived.  In 15cm154, 15cf93 -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Adjourned 01:49 pm
